title: A Study of factors which lead Thomas Hudson to his failure in Ernest Hemingways Island in the Stream
abstract: This study is aimed at understanding the life of the main character In Hemingway’s Island In The Stream, that is. Thomas Hudson. As a famous and rich painter, he seems successful in his life, but in other side, he is a failure. He fails in his two marriages, he fails to express his love through his sons. Hudson’s life is full of pain and misery. The writer curious to know about the factors which lead Thomas Hudson to his failure. Through understanding the causes of the failure of Thomas Hudson, the reader may know what kind of person Hudson is. By using theory of characterization and some theories of psychology, such as, theory of motivation, theory of failure, theory of psychological death, and theory of personalities, the writer finds that Hudson is a person who chooses to run away from the reality and to solve his problem he prefers to drink alcohol and works hard The way he solves his problem leads him to his downfall. By studying the character in Island in The Stream, we will find a lesson that every human being will face failure in his life. Through thisand do not ever try to run away from it. if you run away from the reality, it could be danger our lives.
contributors: SANTIKO BUDI (Advisor 1); Julia Eka Rini (Examination Committee 1)
subjects: AMERICAN FICTION--20TH CENTURY--STUDY AND TEACHING; HEMINGWAY, ERNEST, 1898-1962. ISLAND IN THE STREAM-STUDY AND TEACHING
